title: How-To Guide: Using the Scenario Console

content.text: The Scenario Console is where you experience a historical market replay using real past price data. Here, you can view charts, place trades, track your portfolio, and control the simulation speed. All progress is automatically saved so you can continue your attempt anytime.
The left panel displays important information about the scenario you are currently running. This helps you understand the background and context of the event being simulated.

content.title: Details Shown:
items: Start and end dates of the historical period
Your starting balance for this attempt

content.text: The scenario chart visualizes real historical price movements from the time period being replayed. As the simulation progresses, new data points appear automatically in real time.

content.title: How to Use the Chart:
items: Click 'Generate Chart' to load historical pricing data.
Watch the chart update as the scenario plays forward.
Use 'Reset Zoom' to return the chart to its original view.

content.text: The trading panel on the right allows you to place simulated buy or sell orders using the historical prices being replayed.

content.title: Steps to Place a Trade:
items: Select a stock from the dropdown list.
Choose whether you want to Buy or Sell.
Select the order type (Market or Limit).
Enter the price if the order type requires it.
Enter the quantity you want to trade.

content.text: The simulation runs on accelerated time, allowing you to learn faster without waiting for real market speeds. You can adjust how quickly new data points appear.
Speeds above 1× help you complete long scenarios faster, while still maintaining accurate historical price movement.

content.title: Available Controls:
items: Play — Starts or resumes the simulation.
Pause — Temporarily stops the simulation so you can analyze the chart.
Save & Exit — Saves your exact scenario state and allows you to return later.
Finish — Ends your attempt immediately and generates AI insights.

content.text: Save & Exit is especially helpful for longer scenarios, letting you pause and return without losing any progress.
If you choose Save & Exit, your entire progress and scenario state are stored. When you come back, the simulation will continue exactly where you left off.

content.title: What Gets Saved:
items: Your current position in the scenario timeline
The chart data and candles up to that point
All past trades and open orders

content.text: When you resume, the chart and interface will look the same as when you exited—allowing you to continue seamlessly.
Your trade history lists all market orders you executed in the scenario.

content.title: Information Included:
items: Date and time of the trade

content.text: You can export your trade history for analysis or recordkeeping.
This section shows all limit orders you placed during the scenario.
You can export your limit order history for further review.
Your portfolio shows the performance of all stocks you currently hold in the scenario.

content.title: Portfolio Details:
items: Current price based on scenario replay

content.text: This portfolio is separate from your real-time BlackSealed portfolio—each scenario has its own trading environment.

items: The Scenario Console uses real historical market data to simulate how prices moved during that time.
You can accelerate the market replay up to 10× for faster learning.
Save & Exit lets you pause long attempts and return later without losing any progress.
Your trades, orders, and portfolio all update based on the scenario timeline.
This console helps you learn how your decisions would have performed in real market conditions.
